full_summary:
**Tender Announcement: Stage 1 – Texas Gate Replacement, Elk Island National Park**

**Reference Number:** cb-8430-30978501 (Amended 1)
**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0168/A
**Publication Date:** 2023-08-23
**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-09-06 16:00:00
**Amendment Date:** 2023-09-06
**Expected Contract Start Date:** 2023-09-28
**Expected Contract End Date:** 2023-11-30

**Tender Description:**

Parks Canada invites qualified contractors to submit bids for the replacement of the Texas Gate water crossing structure within Elk Island National Park (EINP). The project involves the removal of the existing structure and installation of a new one. The objective is to provide safe and efficient access to the public and park staff.

**Required Specifications:**

* The new Texas Gate must be approximately 7.4m wide and have a span of 4.6m
* The gate must be able to handle large/heavy cattle liners during bison handling operations in December
* The project must be completed by October 31st, 2023
* The estimated value of the project is between $100,001 and $250,000, taxes extra

**Instructions to Bidders:**

* Bids must be submitted via email or fax as indicated in the solicitation document
* Bids received in person or by courier will not be accepted
* The only acceptable email address for responses to bid solicitations is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca
* The maximum email file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes

**Pre-Qualification:**

This is a two-stage selection process. Bidders responding to this invitation will be required to submit a pre-qualification package in Stage 1, which will evaluate their qualifications for the project. Only qualified bidders will be invited to submit a financial bid in Stage 2.

**Technical and Contractual Enquiries:**

All enquiries of a technical and contractual nature should be submitted to the Contracting Authority in writing. Enquiries received after the five business days prior to the tender closing date may not be responded to.

**Regulatory Compliance:**

The project must be carried out in accordance with the National Park Act and other applicable regulations.

**Documents:**

A comprehensive set of documents, including the solicitation package,
